title: Protein Underconsumption
content: Most people are not eating enough protein. The recommended daily allowances (RDA), are considered insufficient. The RDA for protein is roughly 0.8 grams per kilogram of body weight. This is likely predicated on how much protein you need to live versus how much protein you need to thrive. It is suggested that we probably need closer to two grams per kilogram or about a gram per pound of body weight.

title: Concerns About Protein Toxicity
content: The concern is that if you consume enough protein you’re going to overtax the kidneys because that’s how we excrete the excess nitrogen. You’re looking at somewhere in the order of three to four grams per kilogram before you get into the places where you’re going to start to challenge your kidney’s abilities to take care of excess nitrogen.

title: Lack of Protein in Middle-Aged Women
content: Lack of protein seems to be a really big problem in middle aged women. Especially in women that show up with no muscle mass, eating no protein, doing very little strength training. This is seen as a recipe for a shorter life, but more importantly, a lower quality of life.
